intro: Lotononis pachycarpa, commonly known as the thick-fruited lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, swollen, fleshy fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often displaying shades of pink or purple. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
